com.ecs.utils.uploader
Class Upload

java.lang.Object
  com.ecs.utils.uploader.Upload
public class Upload
extends java.lang.Object

Upload by default stores a file list in the local Stellent content server passing in all the attributes name/value pairs as metadata for each file. If a type is passed (which should be a fully qualifed class name) then this class will be invoked instead and used to store the files. (The type class must conform to the Interface com.ecs.utils.uploader.IUpload.

The Upload class is expected to be invoked by the accompanying JSP file which handles requests from the com.radinks.dnd.DNDAppletLite file upload applet.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Gordon Sandeman

Method Detail

setAttributes

public void setAttributes(java.util.Hashtable attributes)
Pass in a set of name/value pairs. These will be used as document metadata if no type (setType) is specified. If a type class is specified then this Hashtable will be passed to this class unmodified.

Parameters:
attributes -

setId

public void setId(java.lang.String id)
Only used if a custom type class is defined. This value is passed to the custom class and can be used as a search key by the custom class.

Parameters:
id -

setType

public void setType(java.lang.String type)
A custom class used to store the files passed by store. The class must conform to the IUpload interface.

Parameters:
type -

store

public java.lang.String store(java.util.List files)
                       throws java.lang.Throwable
Stores the passed files list either by saving the files to the local Stellent instance or by calling the custom class defined by setType. It returns an html formatted success message as this class is expected to be invoked by a JSP page.

Parameters:
files -
Returns:
String containing html formatted status message
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable
